Package suncertify.db

Contains Framework and API to access database files data and structure localy or remotly.

See:
          Description

Interface Summary
Data.RecordsHandler Defines the strategy for database file records bytes read/write operations to be used by an instance of Data.
Data.RecordsLockHandler Defines the strategy for records locking behavior to be used by an instance of Data.
DBMain Define an interface for database file records create, read, lock, update and delete operations.
Engine Defines an engine for managing the access to a single database file data through sessions.
EngineService Defines a service for creating DB engines for local database files, references for remote DB engines, and engines network services.
Session Defines a unique access to a database file engine.
 

Class Summary
CachingRecordsHandler A records handler which adds the behavior for caching records stream to a wrapped records handler.
Data A suitable concrete implementation for DBMain which takes a records read/write and locking strategy and a shared lock to be used when validating records primary keys.
EngineServiceLoader A loader for EngineService implementation.
Schema A descriptor for a database file record structure.
 

Exception Summary
DBInternalException Signal an internal failure occurred in a database engine.
DuplicateKeyException Thrown to indicate a duplicate key constraint has been broken while inserting a record in database file.
EngineServiceException Thrown to indicate a failure in EngineService operations.
RecordDeletedException A RecordNotFoundException exception to indicate a record is not found because it is deleted.
RecordNotFoundException An indicator if a record to be read, updated, or deleted is not found in file or already deleted.
 

Package suncertify.db Description

Contains Framework and API to access database files data and structure localy or remotly.

Engine defines the interface for an engine managing the access to a database file localted in same JVM file system or a reference for a remote database file engine resides in another JVM. An engine provides the access to a database file data (local or remote) through Sessions.
An EngineService defines a factory for creating: database engines for managing the access for a local database file, remote database file engines references in another JVM, and network services for exposing a database engine functionallity to other JVMs. An implementation can be located using EngineServiceLoader which uses java java.util.ServiceLoader to load EngineService implementation from classpath.
Below shows an example for creating a database engine, get database record structure configuration, and reading from a database file data:


    // loads service implementation from classpath
    EngineService service = EngineServiceLoader.locateEngineService();
    File dbFile = new File("....");// path to database file
    // gets/creates and engine for database file
    Engine engine = service.getEngine(dbFile);
    // get database file record structure descriptor.
    Schema schema = engine.getDBSchema();
    // obtain a new session, unique access to database file
    Session session = engine.newSession();
    // get the access to database records
    DBMain dbMain = session.getDataAccess();
    // read a record
    dbMain.read(0);
The same code is used to access a remote database file except construction for engine will be by calling: 

    // pass the host name in which the engine is running, the port, and the
    // unique name assigned to remote engine.
    Engine engine = service.getEngine("somehost",1521,"database");
Other ways can be used to instant the implementation for Engine than using EngineService interface.
